image_analysis.description: Letâ€™s think step by step to describe what you can see on the image. Write down all formatting elements (titles, subtitles, headers, footers, page numbers) and text blocks and tables on the image, and develop a Markdown-transcription strategy.

transcription.description: The Markdown-formatted transcribed text extracted from the image. Ensure **all** visible text **and** structural elements (headers, footers, page numbers, tables, etc.), are transcribed to well-structured Markdown. If there are images or diagrams, indicate their presence with a brief description in square brackets, e.g., [Image: diagram of a cell]. For complex equations or formulas, use LaTeX syntax enclosed within $$ delimiters. Return only the Markdown content in its original language without any additional translations, explanations or Markdown code block delimiters. Set to null if no transcribable text is found.

no_transcribable_text.description: True if the image contains no transcribable text; otherwise, false.

transcription_not_possible.description: True if transcription is not possible due to issues such as poor image quality or illegibility; otherwise, false.
